cards.name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
cards.text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, protection from black and from red
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, protection from black, protection from red
cards.flavor: "No rest. No mercy. No matter what."

foreignNames.name: 怒りの天使アクローマ

cards.name: Arena
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature you control and target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls. Those creatures fight each other. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature you control and target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to the other.

rulings.text: The power of the creatures when the effect resolves is used to determine how much damage is done.
In multiplayer games, you can choose a different opposing player each time it the ability is activated.
Either or both creatures can be tapped prior to using the ability and it still works.

If either target is illegal at the time the ability resolves (whether because it has left the battlefield, because it has gained Shroud or Protection, or for any other reason), the ability taps the remaining target, but no damage is dealt. If both targets are illegal, the ability is countered.

cards.name: Assault
cards.text: Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Auratog
cards.text: Sacrifice an enchantment: Auratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an enchantment: Auratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The auratog enjoys eating its wards.

cards.name: Avalanche Riders
cards.text:
Haste

Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

When Avalanche Riders enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.originalText:
Haste

Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

When Avalanche Riders comes into play, destroy target land.

cards.name: Avatar of Woe
cards.text:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to cast.

Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to play.

Fear

{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {B}{B} to cast it.

cards.name: Avoid Fate
cards.text: Counter target instant or Aura spell that targets a permanent you control.
cards.originalText: Counter target instant or Aura spell that targets a permanent you control.

rulings.text: Avoid Fate must target an instant spell or an Aura spell as it's cast, and it must be targeting an instant or an Aura spell at the time it resolves. It will still resolve if it starts out targeting a spell of one type but the target changes to a spell of the other type (thanks to Shunt, for instance) before it resolves.

cards.name: Bad Moon
cards.text: Black creatures get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: Black creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Battery
cards.text: Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Browbeat
cards.text: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
cards.originalText: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
cards.flavor:
"Even the threat of power has power."

—Jeska, warrior adept
printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Call of the Herd
cards.text:
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

Flashback {3}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token into play.

Flashback {3}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Celestial Dawn
cards.text:
Lands you control are Plains.

Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.

You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.
cards.originalText:
Lands you control are Plains.

Nonland cards you own that aren't in play, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.

You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

rulings.text: The effect to turn all your non-land cards (including artifacts) white is the effect of a static ability. Thus, a color change on a permanent prior to Celestial Dawn entering the battlefield will be overridden by Celestial Dawn's effect.
Celestial Dawn does not change the type of lands which are not on the battlefield. Lands not on the battlefield are what they say they are.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype from a land.

You may use a different color mana than the color required for spells and abilities that require a specific color. If you do, and the spell or ability checks the actual color of the mana, it can tell the difference.

If you pay white mana to activate an ability that can only be activated by spending another color of mana, then any limitations on activating the ability (such as the number of times it can be activated each turn) still apply as if you spent the proper color.
Celestial Dawn no longer changes mana symbols on cards.

Mana produced by spells you control and nonland permanents you control isn't affected by Celestial Dawn. Llanowar Elves will produce {G}, for example. However, any colored mana may be spent only on the colorless part of costs.
Land cards you own that aren't on the battlefield aren't changed to Plains.
If you have nonwhite mana in your mana pool when Celestial Dawn enters the battlefield, it remains there but you can spend it only on the colorless part of costs.

"Enters the battlefield" triggered abilities of lands you play won't trigger since the lands will enter the battlefield as Plains. Effects that modify how those lands enter the battlefield, however, will still work. For example, if you play a Dimir Aqueduct, it will enter the battlefield tapped as a Plains, but you won't return a land to your hand.

If you use a text-changing effect such as Mind Bend on Celestial Dawn to change the word "Plains" to a different land type, your lands are all of that new land type, and they will produce mana of the appropriate color for that type.
If a permanent enters the battlefield while Celestial Dawn is on the battlefield, and then Celestial Dawn leaves the battlefield, the permanent's color will revert to the colors in its mana cost.

cards.name: Claws of Gix
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a permanent: You gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a permanent: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: When the Brotherhood of Gix dug out the cave of Koilos they found their master's severed hand. They enshrined it, hoping that one day it would point the way to Phyrexia.

cards.name: Coalition Victory
cards.text: You win the game if you control a land of each basic land type and a creature of each color.
cards.originalText: You win the game if you control a land of each basic land type and a creature of each color.
cards.flavor:
"You can build a perfect machine out of imperfect parts."

—Urza

rulings.text: When Coalition Victory resolves, it checks for the five basic land types (Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, Forest) and the five colors (white, blue, black, red, green). If a single land has multiple types and/or a single creature is multiple colors, it will count all those types and/or colors.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText:
Flying

Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.name: Consecrate Land
cards.text:
Enchant land

Enchanted land has indestructible and can't be enchanted by other Auras.
cards.originalText:
Enchant land

Enchanted land is indestructible and can't be enchanted by other Auras.

rulings.text: The land can be targeted by land-destroying spells and the spell will resolve, but the land will simply not be destroyed.
If Consecrate Land enters the battlefield attached to a land that's enchanted by other Auras, those Auras are put into their owners' graveyards.
A permanent with indestructible can't be destroyed, but it can still be sacrificed, exiled, put into a graveyard, and so on.

cards.name: Conspiracy
cards.text:
As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.

Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, creature spells you control, and creatures you control are the chosen type.
cards.originalText:
As Conspiracy comes into play, choose a creature type.

Creature cards you own that aren't in play, creature spells you control, and creatures you control are the chosen type.

rulings.text: It does not replace any use of creature types in card text.
This can grant a creature type to animated lands and artifacts that would otherwise have no creature type.
"Legend" is no longer a creature type, and may not be chosen.
If you choose Wall, then your creatures can still attack because creature types don't confer abilities such as defender (any more than, say, choosing creature type Bird would confer flying).
Affected spells, cards, and creatures lose all of their other creature types.

cards.name: Craw Giant
cards.text:
Trample

Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.originalText:
Trample

Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor: Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho Midgets You think you can stand in my way?"

cards.name: Dandân
cards.text:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.
cards.originalText:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.
cards.flavor:
"Catch good today. Start replacing crew tomorrow."

—Faysal al-Mousa, fisher captain, log

cards.name: Darkness
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"If I must die, I will encounter darkness as a bride, / And hug it in mine arms."

—William Shakespeare,

Measure for Measure

cards.name: Dauthi Slayer
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

Dauthi Slayer attacks each turn if able.
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

Dauthi Slayer attacks each turn if able.
cards.flavor:
"They have knives for every soul."

—Lyna, Soltari emissary

cards.name: Defiant Vanguard
cards.text:
When Defiant Vanguard blocks, at end of combat, destroy it and all creatures it blocked this turn.

{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
When Defiant Vanguard blocks, at end of combat, destroy it and all creatures it blocked this turn.

{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Rebel card if you do not want to.

cards.name: Desert
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Play this ability only during the end of combat step.

rulings.text: The ability can be used on any player's attacking creatures. This includes your own and creatures in an attack you are not involved in (for multiplayer games).

cards.name: Desolation Giant
cards.text:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you cast this spell.)

When Desolation Giant enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures you control. If it was kicked, destroy all other creatures instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you play this spell.)

When Desolation Giant comes into play, destroy all other creatures you control. If the kicker cost was paid, destroy all other creatures instead.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.originalText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

cards.name: Dodecapod
cards.text: If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Dodecapod, put it onto the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it instead of putting it into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Dodecapod, put it into play with two +1/+1 counters on it instead of putting it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Dragon Whelp
cards.text:
Flying

{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText:
Flying

{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. At end of turn, if this ability has been played four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp.

rulings.text: The first three times Dragon Whelp's ability is activated in a turn will do nothing other than give it +1/+0 until end of turn. Any subsequent activations will also cause its delayed triggered ability to trigger. That means if you activate Dragon Whelp's ability five times, for example, two different delayed triggered abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step and cause you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp.

If the fourth (or more) time Dragon Whelp's ability is activated during the same turn happens to be during that turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. You'll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

cards.name: Dragonstorm
cards.text:
Search your library for a Dragon permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
cards.originalText:
Search your library for a Dragon card and put it into play. Then shuffle your library.

Storm (When you play this spell, copy it for each spell played before it this turn.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.

cards.name: Enduring Renewal
cards.text:
Play with your hand revealed.

If you would draw a card, reveal the top card of your library instead. If it's a creature card, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, draw a card.

Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return it to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Play with your hand revealed.

If you would draw a card, reveal the top card of your library instead. If it's a creature card, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, draw a card.

Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from play, return it to your hand.

rulings.text: Enduring Renewal only affects creature cards that are "drawn". It doesn't affect cards that are put into your hand from your library, or from anywhere else.
If the creature is only a creature due to an effect, it still goes to your hand. This includes any way to animate a card.
Token creatures cease to exist if they leave the battlefield, so this effect will not let you get them in your hand.

The last ability is now a triggered ability, not a replacement effect.  That means your opponent has the opportunity to remove the card from your graveyard while the triggered ability is still on the stack.
Unless something weird happens, the card you draw as a result of the second ability will be the card you revealed.
If, after the last ability triggers, the creature card is removed from your graveyard in response, it won't be returned to your hand.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Eron the Relentless
cards.text:
Haste

{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate Eron the Relentless.
cards.originalText:
Haste

{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate Eron the Relentless.
cards.flavor:
"Eron would be much less of a hassle if only he were mortal."

—Reyhan, Samite alchemist

cards.name: Essence Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver deals damage, its controller gains that much life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a Sliver deals damage, its controller gains that much life.
cards.flavor: The slivers would survive, even at the expense of every other creature on Otaria.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If you the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore
cards.text:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.

Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
cards.originalText:
Non-Eye creatures you control can't attack.

Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore can't be blocked except by Walls.
cards.flavor: The highway of fear is the shortest route to defeat.

foreignNames.name: オームズ＝バイ＝ゴアの邪眼

cards.name: Faceless Butcher
cards.text:
When Faceless Butcher enters the battlefield, exile target creature other than Faceless Butcher.

When Faceless Butcher leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.originalText:
When Faceless Butcher comes into play, remove target creature other than Faceless Butcher from the game.

When Faceless Butcher leaves play, return the removed card to play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: Three Faceless Butchers cast in succession with no other creatures on the battlefield will result in an infinite loop and the game will be a draw, unless a player somehow interrupts the loop.

cards.name: Feldon's Cane
cards.text: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.
cards.originalText: {T}, Remove Feldon's Cane from the game: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier.

cards.name: Fiery Justice
cards.text: Fiery Justice deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players. Target opponent gains 5 life.
cards.originalText: Fiery Justice deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players. Target opponent gains 5 life.
cards.flavor:
"The fire of justice burns like nothing else."

—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

rulings.text: You must assign at least 1 damage to each target.
You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

The opponent targeted for the life gain effect may also have been targeted by the damage effect. If this happens and the damage effect drops that player's life total to 0 or less, the life gain effect will raise his or her life total above 0 again before the player would lose the game.

cards.name: Fiery Temper
cards.text:
Fiery Temper deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

Madness {R} (If you discard this card, you may cast it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)
cards.originalText:
Fiery Temper deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

Madness {R} (If you discard this card, you may play it for its madness cost instead of putting it into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Fire Whip
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control

Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

Sacrifice Fire Whip: Fire Whip deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature you control

Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

Sacrifice Fire Whip: Fire Whip deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: Remember that you tap the creature as part of the cost of activating Fire Whip's granted ability. So, if you have two Fire Whips on a creature activating the first one will tap the creature, so you can't use the second one or any other ability which requires tapping the creature until you find a way to untap it.
Fire Whip is put into the graveyard if you lose control of the creature since the card text says it can only enchant a creature you control.

cards.name: Flying Men
cards.text: Flying
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: Saffiyah clapped her hands and twenty flying men appeared at her side, each well trained in the art of combat.

cards.name: Funeral Charm
cards.text: Choose one — Target player discards a card; or target creature gets +2/-1 until end of turn; or target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target player discards a card; or target creature gets +2/-1 until end of turn; or target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Gaea's Blessing
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.

Draw a card.

When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.
cards.originalText:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.

Draw a card.

When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

rulings.text: It targets the player and each of the cards. Thus, it is only a "spell with one target" if you choose to target zero cards.
Does not trigger the "if moved to the graveyard" ability if this card is discarded from your hand.

When cast as a spell, you can't choose this card as one of the targets. This is because you choose the targets when casting this spell, and this spell does not go to the graveyard until after it resolves.
You must target a player. You may target zero, one, two, or three cards in that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Gaea's Liege
cards.text:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.

{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Gaea's Liege's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls instead.

{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves play.

rulings.text: When being declared as an attacker, use the "not attacking" power and toughness. It only changes after declaration is complete.
The activated ability doesn't affect whether the land is basic or not. It overwrites any other land types. Being a Forest gives the affected land the ability "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.name: Gemstone Mine
cards.text:
Gemstone Mine enters the battlefield with three mining counters on it.

{T}, Remove a mining counter from Gemstone Mine: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. If there are no mining counters on Gemstone Mine, sacrifice it.
cards.originalText:
Gemstone Mine comes into play with three mining counters on it.

{T}, Remove a mining counter from Gemstone Mine: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. If there are no mining counters on Gemstone Mine, sacrifice it.

rulings.text: Sacrificing this card when the last counter is removed is part of the effect of tapping it for mana.

If the last mining counter is removed from Gemstone Mine in some way other than activating its ability (such as Chisei, Heart of Oceans), Gemstone Mine won't be sacrificed but its ability can't be activated.

cards.name: Ghost Ship
cards.text:
Flying

{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
cards.originalText:
Flying

{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.
cards.flavor:
"That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."

—Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

cards.name: Giant Oyster
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap step.

{T}: For as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, target tapped creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step, and at the beginning of each of your draw steps, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. When Giant Oyster leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, remove all -1/-1 counters from the creature.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap step.

{T}: As long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, target tapped creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step, and at the beginning of each of your draw steps, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. When Giant Oyster leaves play or becomes untapped, remove all -1/-1 counters from the creature.

rulings.text: If the Oyster untaps during the draw step before its ability to add a -1/-1 counter resolves, the -1/-1 counter effect resolves and adds a -1/-1 counter after the -1/-1 counters are removed due to being untapped.
The activated ability can target only a tapped creature.

Activating the ability creates a continuous effect that works only as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, a repeating delayed triggered ability that's in effect only as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, and a delayed triggered ability that triggers when Giant Oyster untaps or when it leaves the battlefield.
Giant Oyster's ability can be activated during your upkeep, and the creature will get a -1/-1 counter during the draw step that follows it.

cards.name: Goblin Snowman
cards.text:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.flavor:
"Strength in numbers? Right."

—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

cards.name: Grinning Totem
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and remove it from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: You may choose to find any kind of card, including a land. You must exile a card (unless the opponent's library is empty); you can't fail to find anything.

"Until the beginning of your next upkeep" means the effect wears off as soon as your next upkeep starts. Your last chance to play the card is usually the End step of the player who immediately precedes you.

The exiled card is played using the normal rules for timing and priority for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions. You'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.

foreignNames.name: にやにや笑いのトーテム像

cards.name: Hail Storm
cards.text: Hail Storm deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and 1 damage to you and each creature you control.
cards.originalText: Hail Storm deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and 1 damage to you and each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"If they can't take the hail, they'd better stay home."

—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

cards.name: Honorable Passage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.
cards.originalText: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals damage equal to the damage prevented this way to the source's controller.

cards.name: Hunting Moa
cards.text:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

When Hunting Moa enters the battlefield or dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

Whenever Hunting Moa comes into play or is put into a graveyard from play, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: You get a +1/+1 counter both when it enters the battlefield and when it goes to a graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.name: Icatian Javelineers
cards.text:
Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it.

{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
Icatian Javelineers comes into play with a javelin counter on it.

{T}, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

foreignNames.name: アイケイシアの投槍兵

cards.name: Jasmine Boreal
cards.flavor: "Peace must prevail, even if the wicked must die."

foreignNames.name: ジャスミン・ボリアル

cards.name: Jolrael, Empress of Beasts
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}, Discard two cards: All lands target player controls become 3/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}, Discard two cards: Until end of turn, all lands target player controls are 3/3 creatures that are still lands.
cards.flavor: "I need no army. I have Jamuraa."

rulings.text: Only affects lands the target player controls when the ability resolves.
The lands do not get a creature type.
The lands retain their abilities.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

foreignNames.name: 獣たちの女帝ジョルレイル

cards.name: Kobold Taskmaster
cards.text: Other Kobold creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Other Kobolds you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: The taskmaster knows that there is no cure for the common kobold.

cards.name: Krosan Cloudscraper
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Krosan Cloudscraper unless you pay {G}{G}.

Morph {7}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Krosan Cloudscraper unless you pay {G}{G}.

Morph {7}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample

Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.

Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
cards.originalText:
Trample

Leviathan comes into play tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.

Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands.

rulings.text: You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

cards.name: Lightning Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance, haste
cards.originalText: Flying, vigilance, haste

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
cards.originalText: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

cards.name: Merfolk Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature with islandwalk.
cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target creature with islandwalk.

rulings.text: Can target a creature with snow islandwalk.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの暗殺者

cards.name: Merieke Ri Berit
cards.text:
Merieke Ri Berit doesn't untap during your untap step.

{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Merieke Ri Berit. When Merieke Ri Berit leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Merieke Ri Berit doesn't untap during your untap step.

{T}: Gain control of target creature as long as you control Merieke Ri Berit. When Merieke Ri Berit leaves play or becomes untapped, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: If Merieke becomes untapped, its "destroy" ability will trigger, but you won't lose control of the creature you took before it's destroyed.

If another player takes control of Merieke, you will immediately lose control of the creature you took, but Merieke's "destroy" ability won't trigger. The affected creature will go back under the control of the appropriate player.

If Merieke leaves the battlefield, you will immediately lose control of the creature you took and Merieke's "destroy" ability will trigger. The affected creature will go back under the control of the appropriate player, then it will be destroyed.

foreignNames.name: メリーキ・リ・ベリット

cards.name: Mindless Automaton
cards.text:
Mindless Automaton enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.

Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Mindless Automaton comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.

{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mindless Automaton.

Remove two +1/+1 counters from Mindless Automaton: Draw a card.

cards.name: Mirari
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor:
"It offers you what you want, not what you need."

—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: Everything about the original spell is copied, including any decisions made on announcement, such as whether it was kicked or its Buyback cost was paid. Effects on the spell, such as Sleight of Mind or Flashback, are not copied.
If the copied spell requires a target and there are no legal targets, then the copy has the same target (which should be illegal) as the original.
If the spell is countered before the triggered ability resolves, then the ability will make a copy of how the spell looked right before it was countered.
It triggers once per spell, so you can't get multiple copies of a spell using this card. And since this card is legendary, you can't control more than one.
The copy is not "cast" so it will not trigger anything that triggers on a spell being cast.
You choose whether or not to pay when the triggered ability resolves.

You are not required to choose new targets. If you do choose, then the targets must be legal. If you don't change them, the spell is placed on the stack whether or not the targets are legal. The legality of the targets is always checked on resolution of the spell, so the spell may be countered at that time if all of its targets are illegal.

cards.name: Mistform Ultimus
cards.text: Mistform Ultimus is every creature type (even if this card isn't on the battlefield).
cards.originalText: Mistform Ultimus is every creature type (even if this card isn't in play).
cards.flavor: It may wear your face, but its mind is its own.

rulings.text: The type "Illusion" is printed on the card's type line purely for flavor. The Ultimus has every other creature type as well.
Like any creature, if Mistform Ultimus becomes another type as the result of a spell or ability, it will lose all its other creature types.
Mistform Ultimus has all creature types even if an effect removes its ability. Type-changing static abilities will apply in layer 4 before effects such as Sudden Spoiling's remove them in layer 6.

cards.name: Moorish Cavalry
cards.text: Trample
cards.originalText: Trample
cards.flavor: Members of the elite Moorish Cavalry are very particular about their mounts, choosing only those whose bloodlines have been pure for generations.

cards.name: Mystic Enforcer
cards.text:
Protection from black

Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Mystic Enforcer gets +3/+3 and has flying.
cards.originalText:
Protection from black

Threshold Mystic Enforcer gets +3/+3 and has flying as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

cards.name: Mystic Snake
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

When Mystic Snake enters the battlefield, counter target spell.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may play this spell any time you could play an instant.)

When Mystic Snake comes into play, counter target spell.
cards.flavor: Its fangs are in your flesh before its hiss leaves your ears.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas
cards.text:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nicol Bolas unless you pay {U}{B}{R}.

Whenever Nicol Bolas deals damage to an opponent, that player discards his or her hand.
cards.originalText:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nicol Bolas unless you pay {U}{B}{R}.

Whenever Nicol Bolas deals damage to an opponent, that player discards his or her hand.

rulings.text: Nicol Bolas's third ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

cards.name: Orcish Librarian
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Look at the top eight cards of your library. Exile four of them at random, then put the rest on top of your library in any order.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Look at the top eight cards of your library. Remove four of them at random from the game, then put the rest on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: "Us hungry, need food . . . . Lots of books . . . . Hmm . . . ."

rulings.text: You do get to look at the remaining 4 cards before deciding which order to put them back in.

cards.name: Orgg
cards.text:
Trample

Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.

Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.originalText:
Trample

Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.

Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: It's bigger than it thinks.

rulings.text: Whether or not the creatures could attack or block is not important, just whether or not the defending player controls such a creature.

cards.name: Ovinomancer
cards.text:
When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.

{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller puts a 0/1 green Sheep creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
When Ovinomancer comes into play, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.

{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller puts a 0/1 green Sheep creature token into play.

rulings.text: Can target itself. This will cause it to be returned to your hand during announcement and will result in no sheep since it will not be on the battlefield at resolution so the effect fails since it target is illegal.

cards.name: Pandemonium
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.
cards.flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so"

—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: The triggered ability does not check the creature's power until the ability resolves. If the creature is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it does damage equal to the power of the creature right before it left the battlefield. This means that if a creature enters the battlefield which can destroy itself as a "enters the battlefield" ability, the order of resolution of the triggered abilities does not matter.

If player A controls Pandemonium when a creature enters the battlefield under player B's control, player A controls the triggered ability even though player B chooses the target and chooses whether to have the creature deal damage, which could be important if multiple abilities controlled by multiple players trigger.

cards.name: Pendelhaven
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . Stand like Druids of eld."

—Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, 

"Evangeline"

rulings.text: The current power/toughness being 1/1 is a targeting requirement so it is checked when announcing and again right before resolving.

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.
cards.originalText:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Occasionally, members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

cards.name: Psionic Blast
cards.text: Psionic Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.
cards.originalText: Psionic Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Resurrection
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Sacred Mesa
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sacred Mesa unless you sacrifice a Pegasus.

{1}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sacred Mesa unless you sacrifice a Pegasus.

{1}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying into play.
cards.flavor:
"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves."

—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

rulings.text: It can be used during upkeep to create a Pegasus token in time for it to be sacrificed.

cards.name: Safe Haven
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Remove target creature you control from the game.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card removed from the game with Safe Haven to play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: When creatures return to the battlefield, they are put onto the battlefield as if just cast. Creatures with X in the mana cost are treated as X is zero. Creatures which can pay costs when put onto the battlefield to determine abilities must have those costs paid at this time.
Token creatures cease to exist when they leave the battlefield, so this effect just exiles them with no chance to bring them back like you can with cards.
If changed to another land type, the creature cards are not lost but can't be released until the land reverts to normal.
When the creature leaves the battlefield any damage or "will be destroyed at some future time" effects are removed from the creature.
Auras on creatures are put into the graveyard and counters on creatures are removed when the creatures are sent to the Haven.
Creatures return to the control of their owners, regardless of who controls the Haven when it is sacrificed.
All cards in the Haven stay there even if they cease to be creatures. When the Haven is sacrificed, the cards come back onto the battlefield whether or not they are creatures.
Creatures return to the battlefield simultaneously.

cards.name: Scragnoth
cards.text:
Scragnoth can't be countered.

Protection from blue
cards.originalText:
Scragnoth can't be countered.

Protection from blue
cards.flavor: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.

rulings.text: Side-effects of spells that would counter this card will still happen, because they happen even if the spell they're trying to counter can't be countered.
Spells can target Scragnoth and affect it while it is on the stack. Only effects that counter spells are ignored.
Spells with a side effect that only happens if a spell is countered do not have their side effect happen when the countering fails.

cards.name: Sengir Autocrat
cards.text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.

When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
cards.originalText:
When Sengir Autocrat comes into play, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens into play.

When Sengir Autocrat leaves play, remove all Serf tokens from the game.
cards.flavor:
"A thankless job, and a death sentence besides."

—Eron the Relentless

rulings.text: When it leaves the battlefield, it exiles all Serf tokens on the battlefield and not just the ones it generated or just the ones under your control.

cards.name: Serrated Arrows
cards.text:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.

At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.

{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Serrated Arrows comes into play with three arrowhead counters on it.

At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.

{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you've somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

cards.name: Shadow Guildmage
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.

{R}, {T}: Shadow Guildmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.

{R}, {T}: Shadow Guildmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
To keep the dead so others may live.

—Shadow Guild maxim

foreignNames.name: 祭影師ギルドの魔道士
Mago del Gremio de las Sombras

cards.name: Shadowmage Infiltrator
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

Whenever Shadowmage Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Fear

Whenever Shadowmage Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Sindbad
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.
cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

rulings.text: If the draw is replaced by another effect, none of the rest of Sindbad's ability applies, even if the draw is replaced by another draw (such as with Enduring Renewal).
To avoid confusion, reveal the card you draw before putting it with the rest of the cards in your hand.

cards.name: Sol'kanar the Swamp King
cards.text:
Swampwalk

Whenever a player casts a black spell, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText:
Swampwalk

Whenever a player plays a black spell, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Will not trigger off itself being cast.

cards.name: Soltari Priest
cards.text:
Protection from red

Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.originalText:
Protection from red

Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

cards.name: Soul Collector
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever a creature dealt damage by Soul Collector this turn dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.

Morph {B}{B}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

Whenever a creature dealt damage by Soul Collector this turn is put into a graveyard, return that card to play under your control.

Morph {B}{B}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: The ability only triggers if this card is face up at the time the creature is put into the graveyard.

cards.name: Spike Feeder
cards.text:
Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Spike Feeder comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.

{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Spined Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.originalText: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

rulings.text: If two Spined Slivers are on the battlefield then each blocked sliver gets +2/+2 for each creature blocking it.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If you the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Spitting Slug
cards.text: Whenever Spitting Slug blocks or becomes blocked, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. Otherwise, each creature blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Whenever Spitting Slug blocks or becomes blocked, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. Otherwise, each creature blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Squire
cards.flavor:
"Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse.

Of his stature he was of evene lengthe.

And wonderly delyvere, and of greete strengthe."

—Geoffrey Chaucer,

The Canterbury Tales

cards.name: Stormbind
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Stormbind deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: {2}, Discard a card at random: Stormbind deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Once, our people could call down the storm itself to do our bidding."

—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

rulings.text: Since the discard is a cost, it can't be used with Library of Leng.

cards.name: Stormscape Familiar
cards.text:
Flying

White spells and black spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.originalText:
Flying

White spells and black spells you play cost {1} less to play.
cards.flavor: Each Stormscape apprentice must hand-raise and train an owl before attaining the rank of master.

rulings.text: If a spell is both white and black, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.name: Stupor
cards.text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
cards.originalText: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.
cards.flavor:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.

—Suq'Ata saying

cards.name: Suq'Ata Lancer
cards.text:
Haste

Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.originalText:
Haste

Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."

—Telim'Tor

cards.name: Swamp Mosquito
cards.text:
Flying

Whenever Swamp Mosquito attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.originalText:
Flying

Whenever Swamp Mosquito attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

rulings.text: Triggers immediately after blocking is declared if at that time no blockers are assigned to it.

An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Teferi's Moat
cards.text:
As Teferi's Moat enters the battlefield, choose a color.

Creatures of the chosen color without flying can't attack you.
cards.originalText:
As Teferi's Moat comes into play, choose a color.

Creatures of the chosen color without flying can't attack you.
cards.flavor:
"Isolation is not the answer."

—Urza, to Teferi

cards.name: Thallid
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid.

Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid.

Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: The Rack
cards.text:
As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.

At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
cards.originalText:
As The Rack comes into play, choose an opponent.

At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
cards.flavor: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the rack was once his most feared creation.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as this card enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Thornscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {R} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {R} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)

When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {R} kicker, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, destroy target artifact.

foreignNames.name: 荊景学院の戦闘魔道士

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Tormod's Crypt
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Remove target player's graveyard from the game.
cards.flavor: The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.

cards.name: Tribal Flames
cards.text: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.originalText: Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Fire is the universal language."

—Jhoira, master artificer

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.

Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.

Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

cards.name: Uncle Istvan
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.
cards.flavor: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.

rulings.text: Works even on damage from activated abilities of creatures such as Prodigal Sorcerer.

cards.name: Unstable Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

cards.name: Verdeloth the Ancient
cards.text:
Kicker {X} (You may pay an additional {X} as you cast this spell.)

Saproling creatures and other Treefolk creatures get +1/+1.

When Verdeloth the Ancient enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {X} (You may pay an additional {X} as you play this spell.)

All other Treefolk and all Saprolings get +1/+1.

When Verdeloth the Ancient comes into play, if the kicker cost was paid, put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play.

rulings.text: Verdeloth won't give himself +1/+1 unless he somehow becomes a Saproling.

cards.name: Vhati il-Dal
cards.text: {T}: Target creature's power or toughness becomes 1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature's power or toughness becomes 1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Sir, I just thought . . . ," explained Vhati.

"Don't think," interrupted Greven. "It doesn't suit you."

rulings.text: You don't choose whether to affect the targeted creature's power or its toughness until the ability resolves.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.name: Void
cards.text: Choose a number. Destroy all artifacts and creatures with converted mana cost equal to that number. Then target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards with converted mana cost equal to the number.
cards.originalText: Choose a number. Destroy all artifacts and creatures with converted mana cost equal to that number. Then target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards with converted mana cost equal to the number.

rulings.text: You can choose zero. Token creatures and artifact lands have converted mana costs of zero, for example.

cards.name: Willbender
cards.text:
Morph {1}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

When Willbender is turned face up, change the target of target spell or ability with a single target.
cards.originalText:
Morph {1}{U} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

When Willbender is turned face up, change the target of target spell or ability with a single target.

rulings.text: The trigger occurs when you use the Morph ability to turn the card face up, or when an effect turns it face up. It will not trigger on being revealed or on leaving the battlefield.

If a spell with split second is on the stack, you can still respond by turning this creature face up and targeting that spell with the trigger. This is because split second only stops players from casting spells or activating abilities, while turning a creature face up is a special action.
